page.title: 02INDUSTRY
page.content: FORESTRY MUCH OF OUR AREA IS SURROUNDED BY FOREST CONSISTING OF THE CONIFEROUS TREES JAPANESE LARCH AND SITKA SPRUCE WHICH THRIVE ON POOR WET CONDITIONS. THE NORWAY SPRUCE<CHRISTMAS TREE> IS ALSO GROWN AND 5OOO OF THESE WERE SOLD IN DECEMBER 1984. DURING THE EARLY MONTHS OF 1985,ONE MILLION TREES WERE PLANTED BY HAND BY TWENTY MEN.THE FORESTRY COVERS 26,000 ACRES AND EMPLOYS SIXTY PEOPLE. {WHEN MATURE, THE WOOD IS USED FOR {PAPER,CHIPBOARD,FENCING,PIT PROPS, {FURNITURE ETC.THE FORESTRY PROVIDES A {PLACE OF RECREATION FOR PICNICS,WALKS, {FISHING AND PONY TREKKING.ALTHOUGH AN {INDUSTRY, THE FORESTRY USES NO {FERTILIZERS OR INSECT REPELLANTS. IT {HAS BECOME A HAVEN FOR {WILDLIFE,PROVIDING HOMES FOR MANY A {SPECIES OF RARE BIRD AND ANIMAL. }
